<a id="Color"></a>

# Color

A color represented in RGBA format.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A color represented in RGBA format by a red ([r](Color.md#Color_property_r)), green ([g](Color.md#Color_property_g)), blue ([b](Color.md#Color_property_b)), and alpha ([a](Color.md#Color_property_a)) component. Each component is a 32-bit floating-point value, usually ranging from ``0.0`` to ``1.0``. Some properties (such as [CanvasItem.modulate](CanvasItem.md#CanvasItem_property_modulate)) may support values greater than ``1.0``, for overbright or HDR (High Dynamic Range) colors.

Colors can be created in various ways: By the various **Color** constructors, by static methods such as [from_hsv()](Color.md#Color_method_from_hsv), and by using a name from the set of standardized colors based on [X11 color names](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X11_color_names) with the addition of [TRANSPARENT](Color.md#Color_constant_TRANSPARENT). GDScript also provides [@GDScript.Color8()](@GDScript.md#@GDScript_method_Color8), which uses integers from ``0`` to ``255`` and doesn't support overbright colors.

Color data may be stored in many color spaces and encodings. The [srgb_to_linear()](Color.md#Color_method_srgb_to_linear) and [linear_to_srgb()](Color.md#Color_method_linear_to_srgb) methods can convert between nonlinear sRGB encoding and linear RGB encoding.

\ **Note:** In a boolean context, a Color will evaluate to ``false`` if it is equal to ``Color(0, 0, 0, 1)`` (opaque black). Otherwise, a Color will always evaluate to ``true``.

\ [Color constants cheatsheet](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/redot-engine/redot-docs/master/img/color_constants.png)

<div class="note">
There are notable differences when using this API with C#. See the C# differences documentation for more information.

</div>

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

**WHITE_SMOKE** = `Color(0.9607843, 0.9607843, 0.9607843, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#Color_constant_WHITE_SMOKE)

White smoke color.

<a id="Color_constant_YELLOW"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**YELLOW** = `Color(1, 1, 0, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#Color_constant_YELLOW)

Yellow color.

<a id="Color_constant_YELLOW_GREEN"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**YELLOW_GREEN** = `Color(0.6039216, 0.8039216, 0.19607843, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#Color_constant_YELLOW_GREEN)

Yellow green color.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="Color_property_a"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **a** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_a)

The color's alpha component, typically on the range of 0 to 1. A value of 0 means that the color is fully transparent. A value of 1 means that the color is fully opaque.

\ **Note:** The alpha channel is always stored with linear encoding, regardless of the color space of the other color channels. The [linear_to_srgb()](Color.md#Color_method_linear_to_srgb) and [srgb_to_linear()](Color.md#Color_method_srgb_to_linear) methods do not affect the alpha channel.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_a8"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **a8** = `255` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_a8)

Wrapper for [a](Color.md#Color_property_a) that uses the range 0 to 255, instead of 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_b"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **b** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_b)

The color's blue component, typically on the range of 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_b8"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **b8** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_b8)

Wrapper for [b](Color.md#Color_property_b) that uses the range 0 to 255, instead of 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_g"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **g** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_g)

The color's green component, typically on the range of 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_g8"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **g8** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_g8)

Wrapper for [g](Color.md#Color_property_g) that uses the range 0 to 255, instead of 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_h"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **h** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_h)

The HSV hue of this color, on the range 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_ok_hsl_h"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **ok_hsl_h** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_ok_hsl_h)

The OKHSL hue of this color, on the range 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_ok_hsl_l"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **ok_hsl_l** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_ok_hsl_l)

The OKHSL lightness of this color, on the range 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_ok_hsl_s"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **ok_hsl_s** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_ok_hsl_s)

The OKHSL saturation of this color, on the range 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_r"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **r** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_r)

The color's red component, typically on the range of 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_r8"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[int](int.md) **r8** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_r8)

Wrapper for [r](Color.md#Color_property_r) that uses the range 0 to 255, instead of 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_s"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **s** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_s)

The HSV saturation of this color, on the range 0 to 1.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_property_v"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **v** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Color_property_v)

The HSV value (brightness) of this color, on the range 0 to 1.

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Constructor Descriptions

<a id="Color_constructor_Color"></a>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Color](Color.md) **Color**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_constructor_Color)

Constructs a default **Color** from opaque black. This is the same as [BLACK](Color.md#Color_constant_BLACK).

\ **Note:** In C#, this constructs a **Color** with all of its components set to ``0.0`` (transparent black).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Color](Color.md) **Color**\ (\ from\: [Color](Color.md), alpha\: [float](float.md)\ )

Constructs a **Color** from the existing color, with [a](Color.md#Color_property_a) set to the given `alpha` value.




```gdscript
    var red = Color(Color.RED, 0.2) # 20% opaque red.
```


```csharp
    var red = new Color(Colors.Red, 0.2f); // 20% opaque red.
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Color](Color.md) **Color**\ (\ from\: [Color](Color.md)\ )

Constructs a **Color** as a copy of the given **Color**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Color](Color.md) **Color**\ (\ code\: [String](String.md)\ )

Constructs a **Color** either from an HTML color code or from a standardized color name. The supported color names are the same as the constants.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Color](Color.md) **Color**\ (\ code\: [String](String.md), alpha\: [float](float.md)\ )

Constructs a **Color** either from an HTML color code or from a standardized color name, with `alpha` on the range of 0.0 to 1.0. The supported color names are the same as the constants.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Color](Color.md) **Color**\ (\ r\: [float](float.md), g\: [float](float.md), b\: [float](float.md)\ )

Constructs a **Color** from RGB values, typically between 0.0 and 1.0. [a](Color.md#Color_property_a) is set to 1.0.




```gdscript
    var color = Color(0.2, 1.0, 0.7) # Similar to `Color8(51, 255, 178, 255)`
```


```csharp
    var color = new Color(0.2f, 1.0f, 0.7f); // Similar to `Color.Color8(51, 255, 178, 255)`
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-constructor -->

[Color](Color.md) **Color**\ (\ r\: [float](float.md), g\: [float](float.md), b\: [float](float.md), a\: [float](float.md)\ )

Constructs a **Color** from RGBA values, typically between 0.0 and 1.0.




```gdscript
    var color = Color(0.2, 1.0, 0.7, 0.8) # Similar to `Color8(51, 255, 178, 204)`
```


```csharp
    var color = new Color(0.2f, 1.0f, 0.7f, 0.8f); // Similar to `Color.Color8(51, 255, 178, 255, 204)`
```




<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="Color_method_blend"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **blend**\ (\ over\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_blend)

Returns a new color resulting from overlaying this color over the given color. In a painting program, you can imagine it as the `over` color painted over this color (including alpha).




```gdscript
    var bg = Color(0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.5) # Green with alpha of 50%
    var fg = Color(1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.5) # Red with alpha of 50%
    var blended_color = bg.blend(fg) # Brown with alpha of 75%
```


```csharp
    var bg = new Color(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f, 0.5f); // Green with alpha of 50%
    var fg = new Color(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f, 0.5f); // Red with alpha of 50%
    Color blendedColor = bg.Blend(fg); // Brown with alpha of 75%
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_clamp"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **clamp**\ (\ min\: [Color](Color.md) = Color(0, 0, 0, 0), max\: [Color](Color.md) = Color(1, 1, 1, 1)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_clamp)

Returns a new color with all components clamped between the components of `min` and `max`, by running [@GlobalScope.clamp()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_clamp) on each component.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_darkened"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **darkened**\ (\ amount\: [float](float.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_darkened)

Returns a new color resulting from making this color darker by the specified `amount` (ratio from 0.0 to 1.0). See also [lightened()](Color.md#Color_method_lightened).




```gdscript
    var green = Color(0.0, 1.0, 0.0)
    var darkgreen = green.darkened(0.2) # 20% darker than regular green
```


```csharp
    var green = new Color(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
    Color darkgreen = green.Darkened(0.2f); // 20% darker than regular green
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_from_hsv"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **from_hsv**\ (\ h\: [float](float.md), s\: [float](float.md), v\: [float](float.md), alpha\: [float](float.md) = 1.0\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_from_hsv)

Constructs a color from an [HSV profile](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HSL_and_HSV). The hue (`h`), saturation (`s`), and value (`v`) are typically between 0.0 and 1.0.




```gdscript
    var color = Color.from_hsv(0.58, 0.5, 0.79, 0.8)
```


```csharp
    var color = Color.FromHsv(0.58f, 0.5f, 0.79f, 0.8f);
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_from_ok_hsl"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **from_ok_hsl**\ (\ h\: [float](float.md), s\: [float](float.md), l\: [float](float.md), alpha\: [float](float.md) = 1.0\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_from_ok_hsl)

Constructs a color from an [OK HSL profile](https://bottosson.github.io/posts/colorpicker/). The hue (`h`), saturation (`s`), and lightness (`l`) are typically between 0.0 and 1.0.




```gdscript
    var color = Color.from_ok_hsl(0.58, 0.5, 0.79, 0.8)
```


```csharp
    var color = Color.FromOkHsl(0.58f, 0.5f, 0.79f, 0.8f);
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_from_rgba8"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **from_rgba8**\ (\ r8\: [int](int.md), g8\: [int](int.md), b8\: [int](int.md), a8\: [int](int.md) = 255\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_from_rgba8)

Returns a **Color** constructed from red (`r8`), green (`g8`), blue (`b8`), and optionally alpha (`a8`) integer channels, each divided by ``255.0`` for their final value.

```
    var red = Color.from_rgba8(255, 0, 0)             # Same as Color(1, 0, 0).
    var dark_blue = Color.from_rgba8(0, 0, 51)        # Same as Color(0, 0, 0.2).
    var my_color = Color.from_rgba8(306, 255, 0, 102) # Same as Color(1.2, 1, 0, 0.4).
```


\ **Note:** Due to the lower precision of [from_rgba8()](Color.md#Color_method_from_rgba8) compared to the standard **Color** constructor, a color created with [from_rgba8()](Color.md#Color_method_from_rgba8) will generally not be equal to the same color created with the standard **Color** constructor. Use [is_equal_approx()](Color.md#Color_method_is_equal_approx) for comparisons to avoid issues with floating-point precision error.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_from_rgbe9995"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **from_rgbe9995**\ (\ rgbe\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_from_rgbe9995)

Decodes a **Color** from an RGBE9995 format integer. See [Image.FORMAT_RGBE9995](Image.md#Image_constant_FORMAT_RGBE9995).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_from_string"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **from_string**\ (\ str\: [String](String.md), default\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_from_string)

Creates a **Color** from the given string, which can be either an HTML color code or a named color (case-insensitive). Returns `default` if the color cannot be inferred from the string.

If you want to create a color from String in a constant expression, use the equivalent constructor instead (i.e. ``Color("color string")``).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_get_luminance"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **get_luminance**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_get_luminance)

Returns the light intensity of the color, as a value between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive). This is useful when determining light or dark color. Colors with a luminance smaller than 0.5 can be generally considered dark.

\ **Note:** [get_luminance()](Color.md#Color_method_get_luminance) relies on the color being in the linear color space to return an accurate relative luminance value. If the color is in the sRGB color space, use [srgb_to_linear()](Color.md#Color_method_srgb_to_linear) to convert it to the linear color space first.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_hex"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **hex**\ (\ hex\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_hex)

Returns the **Color** associated with the provided `hex` integer in 32-bit RGBA format (8 bits per channel). This method is the inverse of [to_rgba32()](Color.md#Color_method_to_rgba32).

In GDScript and C#, the [int](int.md) is best visualized with hexadecimal notation (``"0x"`` prefix, making it ``"0xRRGGBBAA"``).




```gdscript
    var red = Color.hex(0xff0000ff)
    var dark_cyan = Color.hex(0x008b8bff)
    var my_color = Color.hex(0xbbefd2a4)
```


```csharp
    var red = new Color(0xff0000ff);
    var dark_cyan = new Color(0x008b8bff);
    var my_color = new Color(0xbbefd2a4);
```




If you want to use hex notation in a constant expression, use the equivalent constructor instead (i.e. ``Color(0xRRGGBBAA)``).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_hex64"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **hex64**\ (\ hex\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_hex64)

Returns the **Color** associated with the provided `hex` integer in 64-bit RGBA format (16 bits per channel). This method is the inverse of [to_rgba64()](Color.md#Color_method_to_rgba64).

In GDScript and C#, the [int](int.md) is best visualized with hexadecimal notation (``"0x"`` prefix, making it ``"0xRRRRGGGGBBBBAAAA"``).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_html"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **html**\ (\ rgba\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_html)

Returns a new color from `rgba`, an HTML hexadecimal color string. `rgba` is not case-sensitive, and may be prefixed by a hash sign (``#``).

\ `rgba` must be a valid three-digit or six-digit hexadecimal color string, and may contain an alpha channel value. If `rgba` does not contain an alpha channel value, an alpha channel value of 1.0 is applied. If `rgba` is invalid, returns an empty color.




```gdscript
    var blue = Color.html("#0000ff") # blue is Color(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0)
    var green = Color.html("#0F0")   # green is Color(0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1.0)
    var col = Color.html("663399cc") # col is Color(0.4, 0.2, 0.6, 0.8)
```


```csharp
    var blue = Color.FromHtml("#0000ff"); // blue is Color(0.0, 0.0, 1.0, 1.0)
    var green = Color.FromHtml("#0F0");   // green is Color(0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1.0)
    var col = Color.FromHtml("663399cc"); // col is Color(0.4, 0.2, 0.6, 0.8)
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_html_is_valid"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **html_is_valid**\ (\ color\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="static">static</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_html_is_valid)

Returns ``true`` if `color` is a valid HTML hexadecimal color string. The string must be a hexadecimal value (case-insensitive) of either 3, 4, 6 or 8 digits, and may be prefixed by a hash sign (``#``). This method is identical to [String.is_valid_html_color()](String.md#String_method_is_valid_html_color).




```gdscript
    Color.html_is_valid("#55aaFF")   # Returns true
    Color.html_is_valid("#55AAFF20") # Returns true
    Color.html_is_valid("55AAFF")    # Returns true
    Color.html_is_valid("#F2C")      # Returns true

    Color.html_is_valid("#AABBC")    # Returns false
    Color.html_is_valid("#55aaFF5")  # Returns false
```


```csharp
    Color.HtmlIsValid("#55AAFF");   // Returns true
    Color.HtmlIsValid("#55AAFF20"); // Returns true
    Color.HtmlIsValid("55AAFF");    // Returns true
    Color.HtmlIsValid("#F2C");      // Returns true

    Color.HtmlIsValid("#AABBC");    // Returns false
    Color.HtmlIsValid("#55aaFF5");  // Returns false
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_inverted"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **inverted**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_inverted)

Returns the color with its [r](Color.md#Color_property_r), [g](Color.md#Color_property_g), and [b](Color.md#Color_property_b) components inverted (``(1 - r, 1 - g, 1 - b, a)``).




```gdscript
    var black = Color.WHITE.inverted()
    var color = Color(0.3, 0.4, 0.9)
    var inverted_color = color.inverted() # Equivalent to `Color(0.7, 0.6, 0.1)`
```


```csharp
    var black = Colors.White.Inverted();
    var color = new Color(0.3f, 0.4f, 0.9f);
    Color invertedColor = color.Inverted(); // Equivalent to `new Color(0.7f, 0.6f, 0.1f)`
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_is_equal_approx"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_equal_approx**\ (\ to\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_is_equal_approx)

Returns ``true`` if this color and `to` are approximately equal, by running [@GlobalScope.is_equal_approx()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_is_equal_approx) on each component.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_lerp"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **lerp**\ (\ to\: [Color](Color.md), weight\: [float](float.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_lerp)

Returns the linear interpolation between this color's components and `to`'s components. The interpolation factor `weight` should be between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive). See also [@GlobalScope.lerp()](@GlobalScope.md#@GlobalScope_method_lerp).




```gdscript
    var red = Color(1.0, 0.0, 0.0)
    var aqua = Color(0.0, 1.0, 0.8)

    red.lerp(aqua, 0.2) # Returns Color(0.8, 0.2, 0.16)
    red.lerp(aqua, 0.5) # Returns Color(0.5, 0.5, 0.4)
    red.lerp(aqua, 1.0) # Returns Color(0.0, 1.0, 0.8)
```


```csharp
    var red = new Color(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
    var aqua = new Color(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.8f);

    red.Lerp(aqua, 0.2f); // Returns Color(0.8f, 0.2f, 0.16f)
    red.Lerp(aqua, 0.5f); // Returns Color(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.4f)
    red.Lerp(aqua, 1.0f); // Returns Color(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.8f)
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_lightened"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **lightened**\ (\ amount\: [float](float.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_lightened)

Returns a new color resulting from making this color lighter by the specified `amount`, which should be a ratio from 0.0 to 1.0. See also [darkened()](Color.md#Color_method_darkened).




```gdscript
    var green = Color(0.0, 1.0, 0.0)
    var light_green = green.lightened(0.2) # 20% lighter than regular green
```


```csharp
    var green = new Color(0.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f);
    Color lightGreen = green.Lightened(0.2f); // 20% lighter than regular green
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_linear_to_srgb"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **linear_to_srgb**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_linear_to_srgb)

Returns the color converted to the [sRGB](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SRGB) color space. This method assumes the original color is in the linear color space. See also [srgb_to_linear()](Color.md#Color_method_srgb_to_linear) which performs the opposite operation.

\ **Note:** The color's [a](Color.md#Color_property_a)\\ lpha channel is not affected. The alpha channel is always stored with linear encoding, regardless of the color space of the other color channels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_srgb_to_linear"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Color](Color.md) **srgb_to_linear**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_srgb_to_linear)

Returns the color converted to the linear color space. This method assumes the original color already is in the sRGB color space. See also [linear_to_srgb()](Color.md#Color_method_linear_to_srgb) which performs the opposite operation.

\ **Note:** The color's [a](Color.md#Color_property_a)\\ lpha channel is not affected. The alpha channel is always stored with linear encoding, regardless of the color space of the other color channels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_to_abgr32"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **to_abgr32**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_to_abgr32)

Returns the color converted to a 32-bit integer in ABGR format (each component is 8 bits). ABGR is the reversed version of the default RGBA format.




```gdscript
    var color = Color(1, 0.5, 0.2)
    print(color.to_abgr32()) # Prints 4281565439
```


```csharp
    var color = new Color(1.0f, 0.5f, 0.2f);
    GD.Print(color.ToAbgr32()); // Prints 4281565439
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_to_abgr64"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **to_abgr64**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_to_abgr64)

Returns the color converted to a 64-bit integer in ABGR format (each component is 16 bits). ABGR is the reversed version of the default RGBA format.




```gdscript
    var color = Color(1, 0.5, 0.2)
    print(color.to_abgr64()) # Prints -225178692812801
```


```csharp
    var color = new Color(1.0f, 0.5f, 0.2f);
    GD.Print(color.ToAbgr64()); // Prints -225178692812801
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_to_argb32"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **to_argb32**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_to_argb32)

Returns the color converted to a 32-bit integer in ARGB format (each component is 8 bits). ARGB is more compatible with DirectX.




```gdscript
    var color = Color(1, 0.5, 0.2)
    print(color.to_argb32()) # Prints 4294934323
```


```csharp
    var color = new Color(1.0f, 0.5f, 0.2f);
    GD.Print(color.ToArgb32()); // Prints 4294934323
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_to_argb64"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **to_argb64**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_to_argb64)

Returns the color converted to a 64-bit integer in ARGB format (each component is 16 bits). ARGB is more compatible with DirectX.




```gdscript
    var color = Color(1, 0.5, 0.2)
    print(color.to_argb64()) # Prints -2147470541
```


```csharp
    var color = new Color(1.0f, 0.5f, 0.2f);
    GD.Print(color.ToArgb64()); // Prints -2147470541
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_to_html"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **to_html**\ (\ with_alpha\: [bool](bool.md) = true\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_to_html)

Returns the color converted to an HTML hexadecimal color [String](String.md) in RGBA format, without the hash (``#``) prefix.

Setting `with_alpha` to ``false``, excludes alpha from the hexadecimal string, using RGB format instead of RGBA format.




```gdscript
    var white = Color(1, 1, 1, 0.5)
    var with_alpha = white.to_html() # Returns "ffffff7f"
    var without_alpha = white.to_html(false) # Returns "ffffff"
```


```csharp
    var white = new Color(1, 1, 1, 0.5f);
    string withAlpha = white.ToHtml(); // Returns "ffffff7f"
    string withoutAlpha = white.ToHtml(false); // Returns "ffffff"
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_to_rgba32"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **to_rgba32**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_to_rgba32)

Returns the color converted to a 32-bit integer in RGBA format (each component is 8 bits). RGBA is Redot's default format. This method is the inverse of [hex()](Color.md#Color_method_hex).




```gdscript
    var color = Color(1, 0.5, 0.2)
    print(color.to_rgba32()) # Prints 4286526463
```


```csharp
    var color = new Color(1, 0.5f, 0.2f);
    GD.Print(color.ToRgba32()); // Prints 4286526463
```




<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_method_to_rgba64"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **to_rgba64**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Color_method_to_rgba64)

Returns the color converted to a 64-bit integer in RGBA format (each component is 16 bits). RGBA is Redot's default format. This method is the inverse of [hex64()](Color.md#Color_method_hex64).




```gdscript
    var color = Color(1, 0.5, 0.2)
    print(color.to_rgba64()) # Prints -140736629309441
```


```csharp
    var color = new Color(1, 0.5f, 0.2f);
    GD.Print(color.ToRgba64()); // Prints -140736629309441
```




<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Operator Descriptions

<a id="Color_operator_neq_Color"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator !=**\ (\ right\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_neq_Color)

Returns ``true`` if the colors are not exactly equal.

\ **Note:** Due to floating-point precision errors, consider using [is_equal_approx()](Color.md#Color_method_is_equal_approx) instead, which is more reliable.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_mul_Color"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_mul_Color)

Multiplies each component of the **Color** by the components of the given **Color**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_mul_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_mul_float)

Multiplies each component of the **Color** by the given [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_mul_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator ***\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_mul_int)

Multiplies each component of the **Color** by the given [int](int.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_sum_Color"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator +**\ (\ right\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_sum_Color)

Adds each component of the **Color** with the components of the given **Color**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_dif_Color"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator -**\ (\ right\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_dif_Color)

Subtracts each component of the **Color** by the components of the given **Color**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_div_Color"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator /**\ (\ right\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_div_Color)

Divides each component of the **Color** by the components of the given **Color**.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_div_float"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator /**\ (\ right\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_div_float)

Divides each component of the **Color** by the given [float](float.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_div_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator /**\ (\ right\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_div_int)

Divides each component of the **Color** by the given [int](int.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_eq_Color"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[bool](bool.md) **operator ==**\ (\ right\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_eq_Color)

Returns ``true`` if the colors are exactly equal.

\ **Note:** Due to floating-point precision errors, consider using [is_equal_approx()](Color.md#Color_method_is_equal_approx) instead, which is more reliable.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_idx_int"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[float](float.md) **operator []**\ (\ index\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_idx_int)

Access color components using their index. ``[0]`` is equivalent to [r](Color.md#Color_property_r), ``[1]`` is equivalent to [g](Color.md#Color_property_g), ``[2]`` is equivalent to [b](Color.md#Color_property_b), and ``[3]`` is equivalent to [a](Color.md#Color_property_a).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_unplus"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator unary+**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_unplus)

Returns the same value as if the ``+`` was not there. Unary ``+`` does nothing, but sometimes it can make your code more readable.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Color_operator_unminus"></a>

<!-- classref-operator -->

[Color](Color.md) **operator unary-**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Color_operator_unminus)

Inverts the given color. This is equivalent to ``Color.WHITE - c`` or ``Color(1 - c.r, 1 - c.g, 1 - c.b, 1 - c.a)``. Unlike with [inverted()](Color.md#Color_method_inverted), the [a](Color.md#Color_property_a) component is inverted, too.
